document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for English Language Arts and Reading

B5BDED30DFE701310A1268A86D17958E.description: make connections to own experiences, to ideas in other texts, and to the larger community and discuss textual evidence.

B5BD99A0DFE701310A1168A86D17958E.description: retell or act out important events in stories; and

B5BD5300DFE701310A1068A86D17958E.description: make inferences based on the cover, title, illustrations, and plot;

B5BD09D0DFE701310A0F68A86D17958E.description: monitor and adjust comprehension (e.g., using background knowledge, creating sensory images, rereading a portion aloud);

B5BCB930DFE701310A0E68A86D17958E.description: ask and respond to questions about text;

B5BC6730DFE701310A0D68A86D17958E.description: discuss the purposes for reading and listening to various texts (e.g., to become involved in real and imagined events, settings, actions, and to enjoy language);

B5BC09E0DFE701310A0C68A86D17958E.description: Reading/Comprehension Skills. Students use a flexible range of metacognitive reading skills in both assigned and independent reading to understand an author's message. Students will continue to apply earlier standards with greater depth in increasingly more complex texts as they become self-directed, critical readers.

B5B52BC0DFE7013109F468A86D17958E.description: Listening and Speaking/Teamwork. Students work productively with others in teams. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to follow agreed-upon rules for discussion, including taking turns and speaking one at a time.

B5B4D1C0DFE7013109F368A86D17958E.description: Listening and Speaking/Speaking. Students speak clearly and to the point, using the conventions of language. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to share information and ideas by speaking audibly and clearly using the conventions of language.

B5B48110DFE7013109F268A86D17958E.description: follow oral directions that involve a short related sequence of actions.

B5B41280DFE7013109F168A86D17958E.description: listen attentively by facing speakers and asking questions to clarify information; and

B5B3C7B0DFE7013109F068A86D17958E.description: Listening and Speaking/Listening. Students use comprehension skills to listen attentively to others in formal and informal settings. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to:

B5B36E70DFE7013109EF68A86D17958E.description: use pictures in conjunction with writing when documenting research.

B5B31C20DFE7013109EE68A86D17958E.description: gather evidence from provided text sources; and

B5B2D8A0DFE7013109ED68A86D17958E.description: Research/Gathering Sources. Students determine, locate, and explore the full range of relevant sources addressing a research question and systematically record the information they gather. Students (with adult assistance) are expected to:

B5AFD740DFE7013109E268A86D17958E.description: decide what sources or people in the classroom, school, library, or home can answer these questions.

B5AF7570DFE7013109E168A86D17958E.description: ask questions about topics of class-wide interest; and

B5AF16D0DFE7013109E068A86D17958E.description: Research/Research Plan. Students ask open-ended research questions and develop a plan for answering them. Students (with adult assistance) are expected to:

B5AE9100DFE7013109DE68A86D17958E.description: use letter-sound correspondences to spell consonant-vowel-consonant (CVC) words (e.g., "cut"); and

B5AE4C20DFE7013109DD68A86D17958E.description: use phonological knowledge to match sounds to letters;

B5ADFEE0DFE7013109DC68A86D17958E.description: Oral and Written Conventions/Spelling. Students spell correctly. Students are expected to:

B5ADA9B0DFE7013109DB68A86D17958E.description: use punctuation at the end of a sentence.

B5AD6290DFE7013109DA68A86D17958E.description: capitalize the first letter in a sentence; and

B5AD1FA0DFE7013109D968A86D17958E.description: form upper- and lower-case letters legibly using the basic conventions of print (left-to-right and top-to-bottom progression);

B5ACDA70DFE7013109D868A86D17958E.description: Oral and Written Conventions/Handwriting, Capitalization, and Punctuation. Students write legibly and use appropriate capitalization and punctuation conventions in their compositions. Students are expected to:

B5AC4CA0DFE7013109D668A86D17958E.description: speak in complete sentences to communicate; and

B5ABF880DFE7013109D568A86D17958E.description:
understand and use the following parts of speech in the context of reading, writing, and speaking (with adult assistance):
  1. past and future tenses when speaking;
  2. nouns (singular/plural);
  3. descriptive words;
  4. prepositions and simple prepositional phrases appropriately when speaking or writing (e.g., in, on, under, over); and
  5. pronouns (e.g., I, me);

B5ABB470DFE7013109D468A86D17958E.description: Oral and Written Conventions/Conventions. Students understand the function of and use the conventions of academic language when speaking and writing. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to:

B5AB6ED0DFE7013109D368A86D17958E.description: Writing/Expository and Procedural Texts. Students write expository and procedural or work-related texts to communicate ideas and information to specific audiences for specific purposes. Students are expected to dictate or write information for lists, captions, or invitations.

B5AAD4E0DFE7013109D168A86D17958E.description: dictate or write sentences to tell a story and put the sentences in chronological sequence; and

B5AA81B0DFE7013109D068A86D17958E.description: Writing/Literary Texts. Students write literary texts to express their ideas and feelings about real or imagined people, events, and ideas. Students are expected to:

B5A9D430DFE7013109CE68A86D17958E.description: edit drafts by leaving spaces between letters and words; and

B5A992E0DFE7013109CD68A86D17958E.description: revise drafts by adding details or sentences;

B5A94F50DFE7013109CC68A86D17958E.description: develop drafts by sequencing the action or details in the story;

B5A90980DFE7013109CB68A86D17958E.description: plan a first draft by generating ideas for writing through class discussion;

B5A8BD40DFE7013109CA68A86D17958E.description: Writing/Writing Process. Students use elements of the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, and publishing) to compose text. Students (with adult assistance) are expected to:

B5A86440DFE7013109C968A86D17958E.description: identify techniques used in media (e.g., sound, movement).

B5A80710DFE7013109C868A86D17958E.description: identify different forms of media (e.g., advertisements, newspapers, radio programs); and

B5A7B260DFE7013109C768A86D17958E.description: Reading/Media Literacy. Students use comprehension skills to analyze how words, images, graphics, and sounds work together in various forms to impact meaning. Students continue to apply earlier standards with greater depth in increasingly more complex texts. Students (with adult assistance) are expected to:

B5A76EC0DFE7013109C668A86D17958E.description: identify the meaning of specific signs (e.g., traffic signs, warning signs).

B5A729A0DFE7013109C568A86D17958E.description: follow pictorial directions (e.g., recipes, science experiments); and

B5A6E050DFE7013109C468A86D17958E.description: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Procedural Texts. Students understand how to glean and use information in procedural texts and documents. Students are expected to:

B5A68F70DFE7013109C368A86D17958E.description: use titles and illustrations to make predictions about text.

B5A65000DFE7013109C268A86D17958E.description: discuss the ways authors group information in text; and

B5A61070DFE7013109C168A86D17958E.description: retell important facts in a text, heard or read;

B5A5D050DFE7013109C068A86D17958E.description: identify the topic and details in expository text heard or read, referring to the words and/or illustrations;

B5A58D40DFE7013109BF68A86D17958E.description: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Expository Text. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about expository text, and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to:

B5BBB230DFE701310A0B68A86D17958E.description: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Culture and History. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about the author's purpose in cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and provide evidence from the text to support their understanding. Students are expected to identify the topic of an informational text heard.

B5BB7200DFE701310A0A68A86D17958E.description: describe characters in a story and the reasons for their actions.

B5BB2FC0DFE701310A0968A86D17958E.description: retell a main event from a story read aloud; and

B5BAEA10DFE701310A0868A86D17958E.description: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Fiction. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of fiction and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to:

B5BAA630DFE701310A0768A86D17958E.description: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Poetry. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of poetry and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to respond to rhythm and rhyme in poetry through identifying a regular beat and similarities in word sounds.

B5BA5D50DFE701310A0668A86D17958E.description: recognize recurring phrases and characters in traditional fairy tales, lullabies, and folktales from various cultures.

B5B9D560DFE701310A0468A86D17958E.description: discuss the big idea (theme) of a well-known folktale or fable and connect it to personal experience;

B5B99090DFE701310A0368A86D17958E.description: identify elements of a story including setting, character, and key events;

B5B93610DFE701310A0268A86D17958E.description: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Theme and Genre. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about theme and genre in different cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and provide evidence from the text to support their understanding. Students are expected to:

B5B8C8F0DFE701310A0168A86D17958E.description: use a picture dictionary to find words.

B5B87760DFE701310A0068A86D17958E.description: identify and sort pictures of objects into conceptual categories (e.g., colors, shapes, textures); and

B5B83740DFE7013109FF68A86D17958E.description: recognize that compound words are made up of shorter words;

B5B7F630DFE7013109FE68A86D17958E.description: identify and use words that name actions, directions, positions, sequences, and locations;

B5B7B370DFE7013109FD68A86D17958E.description: Reading/Vocabulary Development. Students understand new vocabulary and use it correctly when reading and writing. Students are expected to:

B5B77080DFE7013109FC68A86D17958E.description: ask and respond to questions about texts read aloud.

B5B729D0DFE7013109FB68A86D17958E.description: predict what might happen next in text based on the cover, title, and illustrations; and

B5B6D990DFE7013109FA68A86D17958E.description: Reading/Beginning Reading/Strategies. Students comprehend a variety of texts drawing on useful strategies as needed. Students are expected to:

B5B68710DFE7013109F968A86D17958E.description: identify and read at least 25 high-frequency words from a commonly used list.

B5B645A0DFE7013109F868A86D17958E.description: recognize that new words are created when letters are changed, added, or deleted; and

B5B60270DFE7013109F768A86D17958E.description: use knowledge of letter-sound relationships to decode regular words in text and independent of content (e.g., VC, CVC, CCVC, and CVCC words);

B5B5BD50DFE7013109F668A86D17958E.description: identify the common sounds that letters represent;

B5B577B0DFE7013109F568A86D17958E.description: Reading/Beginning Reading Skills/Phonics. Students use the relationships between letters and sounds, spelling patterns, and morphological analysis to decode written English. Students are expected to:

B5B29620DFE7013109EC68A86D17958E.description: segment spoken one-syllable words into two to three phonemes (e.g., dog:/d/ …/o/ …/g/).

B5B25520DFE7013109EB68A86D17958E.description: isolate the initial sound in one-syllable spoken words; and

B5B210A0DFE7013109EA68A86D17958E.description: blend spoken phonemes to form one-syllable words (e.g., /m/ …/a/ …/n/ says man);

B5B1C8D0DFE7013109E968A86D17958E.description: blend spoken onsets and rimes to form simple words (e.g., onset/c/ and rime/at/ make cat);

B5B17780DFE7013109E868A86D17958E.description: recognize spoken alliteration or groups of words that begin with the same spoken onset or initial sound (e.g., "baby boy bounces the ball");

B5B13700DFE7013109E768A86D17958E.description: distinguish orally presented rhyming pairs of words from non-rhyming pairs;

B5B0F590DFE7013109E668A86D17958E.description: orally generate rhymes in response to spoken words (e.g., "What rhymes with hat?");

B5B07260DFE7013109E468A86D17958E.description: identify a sentence made up of a group of words;

B5B02950DFE7013109E368A86D17958E.description: Reading/Beginning Reading Skills/Phonological Awareness. Students display phonological awareness. Students are expected to:

B5A54950DFE7013109BE68A86D17958E.description: identify different parts of a book (e.g., front and back covers, title page).

B5A50610DFE7013109BD68A86D17958E.description: hold a book right side up, turn its pages correctly, and know that reading moves from top to bottom and left to right; and

B5A4AC40DFE7013109BC68A86D17958E.description: recognize that sentences are comprised of words separated by spaces and demonstrate the awareness of word boundaries (e.g., through kinesthetic or tactile actions such as clapping and jumping);

B5A46B10DFE7013109BB68A86D17958E.description: recognize the difference between a letter and a printed word;

B5A427D0DFE7013109BA68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate the one-to-one correspondence between a spoken word and a printed word in text;

B5A39B10DFE7013109B868A86D17958E.description: recognize that spoken words can be represented by print for communication;

B5A35500DFE7013109B768A86D17958E.description: Reading/Beginning Reading Skills/Print Awareness. Students understand how English is written and printed. Students are expected to:
